snippet: The fatal encounter between Trayvon Martin and George Zimmerman has polarized the nation, shining an unforgiving light on issues such as race relations and gun control.
abstract: River of protest rages once again in Sanford, Fla, to demand justice in the fatal encounter between Trayvon Martin and George Zimmerman, which is polarizing the nation; this modest central Florida community finds its name being mentioned with Selma and Birmingham on a civil rights list held sacred in black American culture; across the country, the parsing of the case has become cacophonic and political, punctuated by pleas for tolerance, words of hatred, and spins from the left and right.

byline.original: By DAN BARRY, SERGE F. KOVALESKI, CAMPBELL ROBERTSON and LIZETTE ALVAREZ
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Joseph Freeman from Sanford; Beth Raymer from West Palm Beach, Fla.; Sabrina Tavernise and Timothy Williams from Manassas, Va.; and Jennifer Preston from New York. Alain Delaquérière and Sheelagh McNeill contributed research.

lead_paragraph: The fatal encounter between Trayvon Martin and George Zimmerman has polarized the nation, shining an unforgiving light on issues such as race relations and gun control.

headline.seo: Trayvon Martin Shooting Prompts a Review of Ideals
headline.main: Race, Tragedy and Outrage Collide After a Shot in Florida
headline.print_headline: In the Eye of a Firestorm
